body_html:
ci_build script is very helpful to me, i think it is not fair if you are not supporting it ..

By the way, I found the root cause of the problem: buildifier is renamed to buildtools. So the ci will fail if you run with from the beginning. I upgrade to the right version and it works now.

--- a/tensorflow/tools/ci_build/install/install_buildifier.sh
+++ b/tensorflow/tools/ci_build/install/install_buildifier.sh
@@ -17,7 +17,7 @@
 set -e
 BUILDIFIER_DIR="buildifier"
 mkdir ${BUILDIFIER_DIR}
-curl -Ls https://github.com/bazelbuild/buildifier/archive/0.4.3.tar.gz | \
+curl -Ls https://github.com/bazelbuild/buildtools/archive/0.4.5.tar.gz | \
     tar -C "${BUILDIFIER_DIR}" --strip-components=1 -xz
 pushd ${BUILDIFIER_DIR}

Can i open a PR for this?

body:
`ci_build` script is very helpful to me, i think it is not fair if you are not supporting it ..

By the way, I found the root cause of the problem: buildifier is renamed to buildtools. So the ci will fail if you run with from the beginning. I upgrade to the right version and it works now.

```
--- a/tensorflow/tools/ci_build/install/install_buildifier.sh
+++ b/tensorflow/tools/ci_build/install/install_buildifier.sh
@@ -17,7 +17,7 @@
 set -e
 BUILDIFIER_DIR="buildifier"
 mkdir ${BUILDIFIER_DIR}
-curl -Ls https://github.com/bazelbuild/buildifier/archive/0.4.3.tar.gz | \
+curl -Ls https://github.com/bazelbuild/buildtools/archive/0.4.5.tar.gz | \
     tar -C "${BUILDIFIER_DIR}" --strip-components=1 -xz
 pushd ${BUILDIFIER_DIR}
```
Can i open a PR for this?
